title: Masked robbers hit Hamilton stores with crowbar, hammer in crime spree
text:
Masked robbers hit Hamilton stores with crowbar, hammer in crime spree PHILLIPA YALDEN Last updated 21:17, February 11 2017 SIMON MAUDE/FAIRFAX NZ 
Police are investigating the robberies of two stores in the Hamilton suburb of Dinsdale on Saturday night. 
Masked offenders have gone on a crime spree in Hamilton, stealing cars and robbing stores while armed with a hammer and crowbar. 
Between six to nine people wearing skull motorcycle masks and driving two stolen cars robbed a liquor store and dairy in the Hamilton suburb of Dinsdale. 
The robberies took place during a busy time at the shops on Tuhikaramea and Whatawhata Rds about 7pm on Saturday. 
One person working in the dairy was left injured after being struck with a crowbar by one of the masked robbers, Senior Sergeant Greg Foster of Waikato Police said. 
"Two cars have pulled up at the same time in a clearly planned move to rob the liquor store and dairy." 
A group of three people were believed to have run into the dairy armed with a crowbar or similar weapon, he said. 
"The worker has been struck with the crowbar and is currently receiving medical treatment." 
He said the group were wearing motorcycle masks with a black and white skull on them, which were believed to have been shoplifted from a store in Frankton earlier on Saturday. 
One of the vehicles - a blue 2006 Mazda Demio registration DZC148 - was also stolen from Frankton, Foster said. 
At the same time about six robbers are believed to have entered the nearby liquor store. 
Inside one wielded a hammer. 
"They have stolen liquor and cash." 
No one was reportedly injured at the liquor store, although there were customers around the store at the time, Foster said. 
"There are other people helping with our inquiries. It is quite a busy area at this time of night and there were a number of witnesses that police are still speaking with." 
He said it was not clear if some of the group had been involved in both robberies, but there were six to nine people in two cars linked to both. At least one was a woman. 
They were last seen travelling east on Kahikatea Dr towards Lake Rd. 
Police are appealing to anyone who has seen the group, or the vehicles - a Mazda Demio and a 2000 black Mazda Familia with the registration ECR885 stolen from Chartwell - to call police immediately on 111. 
"Both these cars were stolen locally and have been offending locally. They appear to be on to a crime wave so please help us to catch up with them before they can cause some more damage." 
Anyone with information can also call Hamilton police on 07 858 6200. - Stuff
